alert.note: Alert for Berks; Lehigh; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 2:46PM EDT until July 09 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Berks County in eastern Pennsylvania... Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... West Central Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Allentown, Northampton, Kutztown, Hamburg, Slatington, Walnutport, Topton, Lyons, Lenhartsville, Claussville, New Tripoli, and Jordan Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 32 and 57. Northeast Extension between mile markers 54 and 68. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
